boat.name: Wonder
boat.full_description:
Wonder is an Itchin Ferry built in 1860 by Dan Hatcher. She was owned by Charles Nicolay from 1960 when he bought her from Ivan Hatchers' estate on the death of his son. She underwent some major restorations at the Newport Classic Boat Museum, Isle of Wight, in the 1990s. Shortly after this she was fitted with an engine for the first time.

She was sold in 2010 and since then her new owner has replaced planking down to the waterline and all suspect frames as well as renewing the rudder and building a new mast and gaff. This work was carried out by Testers at Hollowshore. She now sails out of the Swale. In 2011 she won the OGA East Coast Race.
boat.construction_details: Carvel Pitch Pine on Oak, in original condition
boat.short_description: Wonder is an Itchen Ferry built in 1860 and still sailing on the East Coast of England.

for_sales.sales_text: Itchen Ferry smack designed and built by Dan Hatcher in 1860. Known as King Dan’s masterpiece, `Wonder’ is a joy to sail and is admired wherever she goes. Completely restored, with full set of racing sails. She was winner of the OGA East Coast Race in 2011 and 2013. Fully equipped including Yanmar diesel engine and Garmin chart plotter.
